data.title: Patch Candidate Profile: Paul Davis, Orange Amity Board of Education
data.meta_description: Patch Candidate Profile: Paul Davis, Orange Amity Board of Education - Orange, CT - Orange resident Paul Davis tells Patch why he should be elected to the Amity Board of Education.
data.text:
Orange resident Paul Davis tells Patch why he should be elected to the Amity Board of Education.

ORANGE, CT — As the 2023 municipal elections get closer in Orange, there are plenty of races with candidates who are eager to serve in elected office.

Orange Patch asked candidates to answer questions about their campaigns and will publish candidate profiles as Election Day draws near.

Paul Davis is running for a seat on the Amity Board of Education as a Democratic Candidate.

Education.

BS, 5th Year Certificate

What is your occupation?

Retired Teacher 34 years

Do you have a family? If so, please tell us about them.

Married, 2 children, 5 grandchildren

Does anyone in your family work in politics or government?

Does not apply

Have you ever held a public office, whether appointive or elective?

State Representative 10 years, Orange Board of Selectmen 4 years, Amity Board of Education 4 years

Why are you seeking this office?

As a teacher, coach, elected official, and community volunteer I have worked with and for young people most of my life. In running for, and serving on the Amity Regional Board of Education, I believe my professional background and civic contributions gives me the tools and experience to continue to provide an outstanding secondary education experience for our young people.

Please complete this statement: The single most pressing issue facing my constituents is ___, and this is what I intend to do about it.

Providing top quality education at a reasonable cost. I intend to to continue to work with other Board members, the District Administration, and Staff focusing our efforts in building an environment in which students will feel safe in expanding their knowledge and striving to reach more challenging educational goals.

What are the major differences between you and the other candidates seeking this post?

I bring to the position years of experience in both education and government and a reputation for respecting and working with people who share different opinions.

If you are challenging an incumbent, in what way has the current officeholder failed the community?

I am the incumbent, but I am proud and honored to have served our community, particularly while working with dedicated volunteers on the Amity Board of Education.

What other issues do you intend to address during your campaign?

Updating our curriculum to encourage students in meeting the challenges of our modern society.

What accomplishments in your past would you cite as evidence you can handle this job?

I have a long record of success in addressing education issues, costs of education, and maintaining top-quality facilities.

What is the best advice anyone ever gave you?

Always listen and consider other possibilities.

Is there anything else you would like voters to know about yourself and your positions?

Our children’s education is our more important investment in the future and my highest priority.
